name: Immolating slimes is a patience hobby
name_original: Immolating slimes is a patience hobby
description:
An entry for trijam#193 "Patience!"

You're the brain of the dungeon. Literally. As a hobby, and since you can't go fishing, you immolate slimes. 

How does a dungeon brain burst slimes? It installs pentacles, and activates them when slimes are passing over. Slimes explode, and you like the sound. 

You just have to be patient enough, until a lot of slimes are on the pentacles at the same time.

Gameplay notes
  • Play with the numpad. : keys 7, 9, 1, 3 trigger the pentacles on the four corners of the dungeon
  • You can activate each pentacle once, then the game is over. 
  • The total number of slimes captured is your score.
  • Your patience decreases with time, but also when a slime hits the brain. In this case you burst it in anger, but it does not count as "sacrified"
  • When your patience is passed out, you activate all the pentacles immediately.
  • When you activate a pentacle and burst several slimes, you regain patience (in relief?)
  • There are more and more slimes as time passes. But be careful you don't run out of patience and trigger empty pentacles
Credits
  • Graphics are mainly recycled from previous games, with tiles from https://melthie.itch.io/
  • Sounds: https://freesound.org
